definition: mistake/to make a mistake/to blunder/mistaken
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

sentences.english: But make no mistake - they are there only in service of the mission.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要搞錯，他們在那兒僅僅是是爲了完成使命。

sentences.english: I'm afraid . it is a mistake . I ordered a steamed bread.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕搞錯了吧，我訂的是花捲。

sentences.english: Otherwise the little helpers might get your wish muddled up.
sentences.chinese: 不然，小助手們可能就糊里糊塗把你聖誕願望搞錯了。

sentences.english: I hope I've not mistaken the day.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我沒有搞錯日子。

sentences.english: The goods don't match the bill of lading, something must have gone wrong.
sentences.chinese: 這些貨物與提貨單並不相符，一定是搞錯了。

sentences.english: They mistimed the war by three years.
sentences.chinese: 他們把戰爭爆發的時間搞錯了三年。

sentences.english: What saddens me is that Mr. Fan get it all wrong.
sentences.chinese: 讓我悲傷的是，範先生全搞錯了。

sentences.english: A thunderbolt should commit no error.
sentences.chinese: 雷霆的一擊總不應搞錯目標吧。

sentences.english: My little monster may have made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我的小怪物可能搞錯了。
我堅決認爲是醫生搞錯了。

sentences.english: Cosette thought that she had been mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 珂賽特心裏想，是她自己搞錯了。

sentences.english: Because you take the wrong part, you get typecast, you're dead.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你搞錯了你的角色，死翹翹了。

sentences.english: Many actors have difficulty in learning their lines, and get them wrong even after a lot of practice.
sentences.chinese: 許我演員記不住臺詞，排練了許多次以後還是要搞錯。

sentences.english: No, that's wrong... eleven forty-five, conference here with the press.
sentences.chinese: 哦，搞錯了，十一點四十五在這裏舉行記者招待會。

definition: to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to misinterpret what one sees or reads/to misjudge (sb)/to mistake (sb for sb else)/to misread (a document)
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
to make an error
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
just now/a moment ago
to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
should not/to owe nothing
to misunderstand/to mistake/misunderstanding/CL:個|个[ge4]
as for/when it comes to
